translated: The second fascicle of the Praise of the Auspicious Virtues of the Buddha
Composed by Venerable ÅšÄntaraká¹£ita
Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao Feng Da Fu
I take refuge in the TathÄgata's supreme and wondrous characteristics, the soles of his feet are flat and well-established,
With the pattern of a thousand-spoked wheel appearing on the soles of his feet, the rim and hub of all characteristics are perfectly round,
His hands and feet are soft like cotton, with a webbed radiance appearing between his fingers and toes,
His fingers and toes are all slender and long, with full heels and well-proportioned insteps,
His insteps are tall and full, and his calves are like those of the In-ni-yeh deer king,
His arms are long and round, reaching to his knees, with hidden sexual characteristics like those of a dragon or horse,
His hair and body hair are all glossy and point upward, with each body hair curling to the right,
His skin is fine and smooth, untouched by dirt, with a true golden body that shines brightly,
His seven places are full, including his hands, feet, shoulders, and neck, with his neck, shoulders, and armpits all full and round,
Your appearance is dignified and majestic, with a wondrous and upright body, and your figure is tall and straight,
Like the NÄgakesara tree, your body is perfectly round, and your upper body is like a lion king,
Your constant radiance faces each other one fathom away, and your forty teeth are even and without gaps,
Your four fangs are fresh, white, and exquisitely sharp, and you always obtain the supreme taste among tastes,
Your tongue is thin, pure, broad, and long, and your Brahma voice is profound and wondrous like a heavenly drum,

Those who hear your voice are all delighted, and it is also like the voice of the kalaviá¹…ka bird,ğŸ”½Your eyelashes are even and orderly, like those of the king of oxen, and your eyeballs are pure and the color of lapis lazuli,
The soft and wondrous tuft of white hair between your eyebrows is coiled to the right, pure like a white conch,
Adorned with the uá¹£á¹‡Ä«á¹£a on the top of your head, I bow to you, the one endowed with the marks of a great man.
I take refuge in the TathÄgata's minor marks, your fingernails are narrow and long, like red copper,
The fingers and toes are round and slender, the fingers and toes are all in sequence,
The sinews and veins are coiled and hidden, the two ankles are hidden and not rough,
Full and soft feet are level, looking back to the right like a deer king,ğŸ”½Walking straight like an elephant king, manifestly upright and unobstructed,
The sequence of movements is like a goose king, the body turns following the steps, walking steadily,
The body parts are in sequence, tall and upright, turning equally, the body not crooked,
The good characteristics are connected, the body is solid, the body is pure and bright, free from obscurity,
The body parts are stable and not shaking, the upright body characteristics are well-rounded,
The pure body of the excellent youth is soft and wonderful, incomparable,
The belly shape is square and without deficiency, not sunken or protruding, broad and round,
The right-turning deep and thick navel chakra is pure, without any holes or defects,
The body parts and tactile sensations are free from faults, without any moles, warts, or growths,
Just like a lotus, defilements do not contaminate it, and it is also free from all restlessness.
The face chakra is perfectly round and bright, the bodily characteristics are complete without any defects,ğŸ”½The tongue is broad and long like red copper, soft and supple like lotus leaves,
The lips are lustrous and lovely, like a bimba fruit or red copper,
The voice is like the sounds of water, clouds, and echoes, and also like the great roar of an elephant king,
The voice is deep, far-reaching, and beautiful, and everyone who hears it is delighted,
The hands are soft like cotton wool, the lines on the hands are deep and distinct,
The four teeth are sharp, wonderful, and firm, the best, pure, and even,
The teeth are square, even, fresh, white, and aligned, the eyes are long and wide like lotus leaves,
The eyelashes are thick and not white, the eyebrows are glossy, not white, and long,
The earlobes are long, wide, thick, and round, the body hairs are each and every one glossy,
The forehead is broad, flat, and of an extraordinary appearance, the upper part of the body is completely full,
The head hair is thick, neat, and long, dark blue, turning to the right, and lustrous,
Up to the Buddha's chest, there are patterns of auspicious whorls,
The conch-like topknot is dark blue, wonderfully adorned, I bow my head to the invisible crown protrusion.
I take refuge in the power of knowing what is possible and impossible, all past, present, and future karma is known,
Meditations, liberations, and samÄdhi gates, discerning the natures of one's own and others' faculties,
Various beliefs and understandings are all penetrated, various realms and destinies are also all known,
The various types of other minds are clearly distinguished, and the knowledge of past abodes is complete,
Illuminating all dharmas of arising and ceasing, all defilements are exhausted without remainder,
Thus the ten powers and wisdom are perfect, I bow to the TathÄgata's great vigor.
The TathÄgata's defilements are exhausted without remaining stains, and he has also awakened to all dharmas without remainder,
Therefore he is called the rightly enlightened and fully awakened Honored One, I now bow my head in reverence and make offerings.
Equally expounding all defiled dharmas, and skillfully proclaiming the paths of liberation,
Fully awakening to all without remainder, I bow to the first awakener, the Able One.
The Buddha possesses indestructible right wisdom, fully and completely awakening to all without remainder,
Right wisdom destroys all mistaken views, the Buddha's true awakening leaves no remaining awakenings,
One's own realm and others' realms, all realms are accomplished,
Among all the meanings of the faculties, the Buddha is the one with unsurpassed faculties.
In the characteristics, there are no remaining characteristics to be relied upon, and the seeds and manifestations of form are all eliminated.
The heavy burden of birth has long been removed, and one has already penetrated to the bottom of the current of dependent origination.
Free from the two kinds of ignorance and darkness, two kinds of wisdom and light arise.
Furthermore, free from the two kinds of doubtful and seeking minds, two kinds of definitive wisdom are established.
Having attained the wisdom of exhaustion and the worldly phrases, free from the obstacles of wisdom and with the Dharma fully illuminated,
Fully endowed with the supreme reliance of the gate of tranquility, fully endowed with the supreme abodes,
Fully endowed with all that should be practiced, fully endowed with bright practices and perfect physical characteristics,
Fully endowed with the lineage and language, attaining the fruits of spiritual powers and skillfully rescuing and liberating.
The actions of body, speech, and mind are all unguarded, with unattached, inexhaustible wisdom and concentration,
The wisdom door of definite non-retrogression, the wisdom expounds the characteristics of the causes of indestructibility.
All kinds of causal gates are fully realized, and the various fruitional gates are also fully known.
The various afflictions and their antidotes, I bow to the TathÄgata, the one who skillfully realizes.
Speech without duality, inexhaustible eloquence, the one who skillfully expounds the Dharma of non-retrogression,
The mind unstained by the eight worldly dharmas, I bow to the one who has skillfully reached the other shore of merit.
For three asaá¹ƒkhyeya kalpas, the Buddha has accumulated all difficult practices,
With a mind of great compassion universally covering, himself and others are able to cross the stream of afflictions.
Fully understanding the three kinds of suffering to be extremely subtle, out of compassion for suffering, great compassion arises.
Among the various natures in the three realms, great compassion universally reaches everywhere.
The nature of the TathÄgata's wisdom is equal, regarding enemies and friends, he views them equally,
The mind of compassion is vast and immeasurable, universally embracing all kinds of sentient beings.
The Buddha speaks of a single medicine for sentient beings, which cures both physical and mental illnesses, bringing peace and comfort,
And ultimately eradicating extreme suffering. I bow my head to the one who skillfully expounds the wondrous medicine.
Pure and true, with definite practice, definitely pure and good, free from defilements,
Definitely not giving rise to defiled dharmas again, single-mindedly nurturing goodness for others.
Not seeking benefits for oneself from others, abandoning all the happiness one has attained,
With a compassionate mind, skillfully using expedient means, definitely subduing the illnesses of sentient beings.
When it is time to subdue sentient beings, the TathÄgata skillfully knows without fail,
Acting as a friend not requested by sentient beings, universally enabling them to cross over, giving rise to a compassionate mind.
The Benevolent One skillfully expounds the wondrous medicine of the Dharma, curing the root of suffering that arises from birth,
Illuminating the past and present bodies of sentient beings, understanding the boundless nature of afflictions,
Cutting off the afflictions and illnesses of sentient beings, the Buddha knows the proper timing without error,
According to whatever illness the medicine can cure, the World-Honored One teaches the medicine as appropriate.
All the practices cultivated by the TathÄgata are fully perfected in accordance with principle,
Whether appearing in one or many, understanding and knowing them all without obstruction.
The TathÄgata, having fulfilled his practices, is able to reach the ground of omniscience and coolness,
Knowing the path, recognizing the path, teaching the path, the Honored One of the supreme path, the one to whom all paths return.
Delivering all from the suffering of saá¹ƒsÄra, causing sentient beings to be free from entanglements and bondage,
Causing all to cross over the current of afflictions, the one who is firm, conscientious, and fully endowed.
Able to well establish the banner of the holy Dharma, indicating that all conditioned phenomena are impermanent,
Opening the gate of extinction and freedom from craving, revealing the path of quiescence and liberation,
The one who can skillfully indicate all dharmas, the honored one who can teach the dharmas,
The great guide who can bring benefit, I bow to the one who bestows joy and delight.
Always speaking words of instruction, benefit, and delight, endowed with great authority and great spiritual powers,
The most supreme and pure great Brahma honored one, I bow to the sovereign who is also radiant.
Having already put to rest all discussions of lineage, and also cutting off all talk of clans and families,
Even the worldly affairs and language are gone, I bow to the one who always speaks the true Dharma.
The Tathagata's gait is always tranquil, neither wide nor narrow, walking with level steps,
In accordance with goodness, those who see it rejoice, indicating the Tathagata's good characteristics in his gait.
The Tathagata's right knowledge and insight are indestructible, fully endowed with the nature of what was done in the past,
Free from thoughts of alms-begging, entering the village,
Departing, must be clearly seen by the multitude, without support, without turning, the most exalted one,
Supremely wondrous, exceptionally auspicious, purely and perfectly practicing the brahma conduct.
Able to thoroughly understand the five aggregates of clinging, and also able to fully possess the seven factors of enlightenment,
Already able to destroy the mind of self-conceit, I bow my head to the one who can destroy the net of delusion.
The TathÄgata has already attained the immovable Dharma, and is also able to fully possess the profound and vast mind,
Well able to accomplish the seven noble riches, I bow my head to the one who has well studied the three trainings.
The praiseworthy one among great men, not frightened by deviant and strange objects,
Far removed from all inauspiciousness, I bow my head to the one who has already reached the stage of taming.
The true and well-established brahma conduct, I take refuge in the one who is above, below, and in all directions,
Always bestowing fearlessness upon sentient beings, I bow to the Dharma free from grasping and attachment.
I take refuge in the Buddha, the great Arhat, the Honored One free from all defilements,
Who has accomplished what was to be done and perfected the bright virtues, I bow to the one who has already removed all heavy burdens.
Having attained the meaning and benefits of what was to be done, exhausting all bonds of existence and removing obstructions,
Dwelling peacefully in the mind of liberation through right wisdom, I bow to the one who has attained liberation.
Having already realized the principle of liberation beyond words, liberated through the exhaustion of craving and grasping,
The mind liberated and perfect, without forgetfulness, I bow to the one with an unperverted mind.
The Buddha's mind is immeasurable and vast, the mind well cultivated without any different dharmas,
The mind liberated, free from bondage and afflictions removed, I bow to the one who has already shattered all differences.
Having exhausted defiled karma and attained purity, having already realized nirvÄá¹‡a without remainder,
The most supreme among humans, the honored one of liberation, who defeated the army of Mara and attained victory,
Not negligent in the wholesome dharmas, well abiding in right mindfulness and right wisdom,
Well opening the eye of tranquility to see sentient beings, I bow to the one who skillfully rescues from the suffering of birth and death.
Skillfully awakening sentient beings from the sleep of ignorance, skillfully destroying the foolishness of sentient beings,
The Buddha, with diligent courage and a mind of vigor, inspires all the lazy ones.
Among the unwholesome, he bestows wholesome dharmas; among those fallen into learning, he opens the door of learning;
Among the fearful, he bestows fearlessness; to those who are not at ease, he brings ease.
In the midst of darkness, he creates illumination; in the unwholesome, he causes the cultivation of goodness;
In the midst of faults, merit arises; in the midst of evil karma, evil karma is eliminated;
Causing those who are disobedient to know the virtue of gratitude, able to fulfill the wishes and desires of the multitude,
The true cultivation of mantra and wisdom accomplishment, I bow my head to the one who can destroy afflictions.
The Buddha has already abandoned all deception and falsehood, his mind is not agitated or arrogant,
The honored one reveals the auspicious gate, I bow my head to the Buddha, the source of blessings and virtue.
In one instant, all practices arise, the spiritual powers and types are not shared by all,
Ultimately accomplishing the supreme gate, in all places, free from non-phrase meanings,
All doubts and mixed explanations, the definitive correct speech can all be destroyed,
The practices of all auspiciousness are cultivated equally, well understanding the intentions of all sentient beings.
Already able to subdue the words of others, just like a fierce fire burning dry firewood,
Burning all afflictions, the meaning is also so, I bow my head to the one who abides in the Dharma of the righteous one.
Endowed with all auspiciousness, endowed with shame and dishonor, the lord and ruler of the world, supreme and silent,
The great guide Shakyamuni, of the Angirasa Gautama clan,
Free from the darkness of afflictions and delusion, with compassion embracing all beings,
Always engaged in benefiting others, fully endowed with vast and excellent practices.
The Buddha, among all types of beings and all superior practices,
The Buddha always observes with great wisdom, universally gathering the affairs that benefit the world.
Endowed with the wisdom of subduing through the six supernormal powers, the wisdom of virtuous wisdom, timely wisdom,
All superior supernormal powers of antidotes, the wisdom of the realms, destinies, inclinations, and karmic hindrances.
Endowed with the supreme supernormal power of expounding the Dharma, skillfully guiding at the three times of subduing,
Fully understanding all the meanings and expressions, I bow to the inexhaustible wisdom of eloquence.
The Buddha has fully attained the eloquence of teaching as spoken, skillfully fulfilling all practices and reaching the other shore,
All merits and liberations are complete, revealing the supreme purity of body and mind,
Hearing the Buddha's voice, the mind is filled with joy.
Not falling into any verbal expression, not grasping the characteristics of one's own merits,
Equally realizing the primordial path first.
The great burden of sentient beings is well-borne, attaining tranquility amidst all characteristics,
Already perfecting the merits of great kindness and so forth, never abandoning the practice of renunciation,
Using right wisdom to embrace sentient beings, thoroughly observing them throughout the long night.
The TathÄgata always generates great courage and valor, teaching sentient beings with all good practices,
And moreover, within all sentient beings, he has attained the good and equal compassion.
The Buddha is the one who has compassion for the world, well understanding the ultimate truth,
The TathÄgata's three eyes are already fully illuminated, and he is well endowed with the three kinds of praise.
Displaying the unstained honored one of the three realms,

The one who has thoroughly penetrated the practice of the four establishments of mindfulness, the one who is self-mastered in the aggregates of names, phrases, and letters,ğŸ”½The one with skillful, inexhaustible, and effortless eloquence, the one who has complete knowledge of all that is to be taught.
Skilfully understanding the various languages, with unobstructed eloquence in all places,
In the midst of all opposition, acting in accordance; in the midst of all anger, acting with purity;
In the midst of all arrogance, giving rise to respect; abandoning all gain and offerings,
The practice is correct and supreme, manifesting the honored one through one's own power,
Purifying all the gates of speech; I bow to the one who is unattached to language.
Uttering the words come forth and words in accordance with meaning, fully endowed with all correct practices,
The TathÄgata's merits are all perfect; I bow to the one who is free from forgetfulness.
Supremely beneficial, excellent guide, joyfully compassionate towards all beings,
With a mind of compassion, firm and wishing to benefit others, I bow to the one who always wishes to bring benefit and joy.
The Buddha has kindness and virtue towards sentient beings, always being a good friend and acquaintance,
Like a father and mother who can give birth, wishing to enable sentient beings to attain goodness and happiness.
The Buddha is the personal teacher of sentient beings, well-expounding the supreme meaning and teachings of the Dharma,
Proclaiming the supreme meaning of the phrases in accordance with principle, enabling them to understand all natures.
The TathÄgata always speaks without attachment, praising without increase or decrease,
Great compassion continuously arises, I bow to the one who skillfully discerns what is possible and impossible.
Praise of the Auspicious Virtues of the Buddha, Scroll 2
